item.title: What are the similarities and differences between SWIFT and blockchain?
item.description:
What are the similarities and differences between SWIFT and blockchain?

Answer: None really. Swift is a messaging standard and a blockchain is a database with some more bells and whistles on top.

item.title: KNCMiner Has a New Owner: Swedish Entrepreneur to Relaunch Mining Operations
item.description:
KNCMiner Has a New Owner: Swedish Entrepreneur to Relaunch Mining Operations

KNCMiner sold most of its assets following a bankruptcy procedure three months ago, however, it has now been disclosed that a Swedish company called GoGreenligh has received approval to buy most of the mining venture assets.

item.title: Bitfinex Gives an Investigation Update - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Bitfinex Gives an Investigation Update - Bitcoin News

Bitfinex has Swiss Capital Zurich Rejects Bitcoin Government revealed more information concerning the investigation of the hack that took place on August 2. The exchange explains the company's initial efforts to identify the hackers and the next steps for the business moving forward. The Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange Bitfinex is back up and operational.

item.title: The importance of security and encryption in the online domain
item.description:
The importance of security and encryption in the online domain

As we move into the digital domain to carry out an ever-growing range of tasks from shopping to playing games like online baccarat, issues of online security and encryption have lost none of their potency.

item.title: BitGo CEO Mike Belshe Believes in Bitcoin Despite Bitfinex Hack
item.description:
BitGo CEO Mike Belshe Believes in Bitcoin Despite Bitfinex Hack

BitGo's Mike Belshe has said that questions raised about the security of bitcoin with some suggesting that digital currencies can never be secure are wrong. After Mt. Gox, the second biggest security breach of a bitcoin exchange took place earlier this month when the Hong Kong-based Bitfinex halted trading after hackers stole around $70 million worth of users' bitcoins.

item.title: Format of mkey field in encrypted wallet.dat file
item.description:
Format of mkey field in encrypted wallet.dat file

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. Join them; it only takes a minute: Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top I am writing a C++ application to scour large files (typically disk images) for wallet.dat files, with the intention of recovering the private keys.

item.title: Man Who Introduced Millions to Bitcoin Says Blockchain Is a Bust
item.description:
Man Who Introduced Millions to Bitcoin Says Blockchain Is a Bust

Stefan Thomas, who introduced millions of people to bitcoin, has had a change of heart. Blockchain, the ledger software that makes the digital currency possible, is too rigid to gain wide adoption, he wrote in an essay titled " The Subtle Tyranny of Blockchain."

item.title: Safe, Not Sorry: How to Treat Cloud Mining Right
item.description:
Safe, Not Sorry: How to Treat Cloud Mining Right

Cloud mining, according to some, is one of the most profitable ways of investing online. Many users are aware of such opportunity and actively use it. Others think that 'making money from nothing' is nothing more than fraud. As always, the truth lies somewhere in between.

item.title: The Next Bitcoin Software Release Will Be the First to Feature SegWit Code - CoinDesk
item.description:
The Next Bitcoin Software Release Will Be the First to Feature SegWit Code - CoinDesk

A forthcoming bitcoin software update will be the first to feature code that could be later activated and included as part of an effort to scale transaction capacity on the bitcoin blockchain.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Holds Above $550 Support
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Holds Above $550 Support

Bitcoin price has halted decline and may have found support at the $555 (Bitstamp) level. The 4-hour candle chart shows that advance is possible, but that a critical watershed for decline remains close-by. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here. Not a member?
